other_tests.findings: No mucosal lesions in the bladder.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Follow-up cystoscopic examinations and cytologic examination of urine specimens showed no evidence of recurrent transitional-cell carcinoma during the next 2 years.

other_tests.date: Three and a half years before evaluation
other_tests.findings: Cells consistent with transitional-cell carcinoma were seen.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Up to that point, cytology was negative; later examinations revealed positive findings.

other_tests.procedure_name: Biopsy specimens of the bladder and prostatic urethra
Cystoscopic examination of washings of the left ureter

other_tests.findings: Malignant cells consistent with transitional-cell carcinoma.
Smooth narrowing of a short segment of the distal left ureter, thought to be due to previous instrumentation.
Circumferential thickening and small irregular filling defects in the midportion of the left ureter, with ureteral dilatation.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Three months before evaluation showed slight enlargement of the circumferential mass.

other_tests.findings: Recent abdominal, pelvic, and chest CT scans negative for metastatic disease. Urinary cytologic analyses have been negative.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Postoperative complications included extensive mucus production and metabolic acidosis; however, the condition stabilized without recurrence.
